channel.title: Comments on: Where is the corruption of agile?
channel.description: Plataformatec's place to talk about Ruby, Ruby on Rails, Elixir, and software engineering

item.title: By: Jeff Dickey
item.dc:creator: Jeff Dickey
item.description: Scrum is a project-managers' employment program. Agile is a set of development practices. Where we've gone seriously off the rails, so to speak, is to conflate one with the other. Going fast in the beginning is, at best, meaningless if your lack of test coverage dooms you to ever-increasing bug counts and riskier changes as the project progresses.
